ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Looking for some volunteers
ygData.msgSnippet: I d be glad to give you input. propellerheadus@yahoo.com is email and ShaggyGooRoo is AOL IM ID.  I m a middle age consulting professional, so I probably have
ygData.messageBody:
I'd be glad to give you input.
propellerheadus@... is email and ShaggyGooRoo is
AOL IM ID. I'm a middle age consulting professional,
so I probably have a different view that might be
valuable to your studies, and I've been playing
computer games since Pong (yes I had a pong machine in
the '70's).

I'm going to start grad school in computer engineering
in January, so I can relate to your need :) I think
EQ would be a great place to do a grad study on
economics.

Quwi


--- haywoodandrew <haywoodandrew@...> wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> This is an odd request, but I am looking for some
> Everquest players that
> wouldn't mind being interviewed either by IM, phone,
> or if practical in person. I
> am a graduate student at the Institute of Design at
> Illinois Institute of
> Technology in Chicago. For one of my classes,
> entitled Observing Users, we
> have to study a product and its users. Our group
> chose Everquest because we
> think that it is very interesting and complex. As a
> retired online gamer I know
> how much fun and involving the games can be. In
> fact, I am very tempted to
> jump into Everquest, but I am worried that I may
> lose concentration on my
> studies. If anyone is willing to devote a little of
> their time to helping us out we
> would really appreciate it. Unfortunately, we are
> poor grad students and will
> not be able to compensate anyone who helps us out,
> but we will very very
> thankful. Thanks
>
> Andrew Haywood
>
>
>
>
>
